Class River

public class River extends Object
Models the overall river ecosystem in the simulation.

      public River(int length)

  • Method Details

    • getLength

      public int getLength()
      Gets the length of the river.
      Returns:
      The length of the river being modeled.

    • numEmpty

      public int numEmpty()
      Finds the number of empty cells in the river.
      Returns:
      The count of cells in the river who are set to null

    • addRandom

      public boolean addRandom(Animal animal)
      Attempts to add a new animal of age 0 and of random gender, who is the same type as the specified animal to a random empty cell. Helper method for processMove(int, int) to fulfil rule 4 in section 1.1 of the project specification.
      Returns:
      True if the operation is successful, or false if there aren't any empty cells.

    • updateCell

      public void updateCell(int i)
      Updates one specific cell of the river. If the cell river[i] is null, no action is taken. Otherwise:
      1. Checks if the animal should be updated (i.e., if the animal already moved this cycle). If not, no further action is taken.
      2. Checks the animal's age. If it's at the end of its lifespan, it dies.
      3. If the animal is still alive, decides if the animal will move—and if so, in which direction.
      4. Calls processMove(int, int) to process the move taken by the animal and any consequeces of it.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the cell in the river array to be updated.

    • processMove

      public void processMove(int i, int targetIndex)
      Helper method for updateCell(int). Moves the Animal in question, processing any consequences of these moves as well.
      Parameters:
      i - The index of the animal to move (the same parameter as in updateCell(int)).
      targetIndex - The index where the animal wants to move (an index one away from i, unless i is at the extrema of the array).

    • updateRiver

      public void updateRiver()
      Performs one cycle of the simulation by calling updateCell(int) on every cell in the river array.

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Produces a string representation of the river, using "---" to represent empty cells and Animal.toString() for animals.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      The string representation of the river.
